website_summaries.verdict: If you're seeking an affordable indoor/outdoor doormat with generous proportions, this is a great choice. We suggest airing it out a day or two before using it indoors, however.
pros: Stylish carpet design improves shoe and boot cleaning
Low profile, will not block doors
cons: Some durability issues in high-traffic areas

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I got the 36” x 24” dark brown for my balcony. I have a garden rack outside and a large ivory area rug in the living room. I also have a black Labrador that loves to sit outside and look over the lake so bringing in dirt was a huge concern. The quality is great, it’s thick and nonslip and I love the design.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Great as kitchen mats!
customer_reviews.text: I did not receive a discount to purchase and write a review on this item. I received four mats five days ago. I don't use them as a door mat. They are being used in my kitchen. They are not industrial heavy, heavy duty. However, they are durable. As you can see in the pictures, they are flat. Also, you'll have an idea as to the dimension and texture. I am very satisfied with these mats.
customer_reviews.author: KIKICAT

customer_reviews.title: Dry quick and nice pattern
customer_reviews.text: A large outdoor floor mat with nice pattern. Dry quickly and absorb dirt from shoes. Like this replacement very much.
customer_reviews.author: amazonreviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great doormat!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this doormat because our boots (plus doggy's dirty paws) brought in a lot of dirt and snow. I will come back to update my review after a few months of use. But so far, it works well. The surface is soft to absorb the snow and not too soft to catch dirt. I wipe my dog's paws on this mat before he can come into the house and he seems to enjoy standing on it.
customer_reviews.author: dknvs

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I use this mat for 1 month. It's useful especially in snow day when I don't want to my dirty boots smudge the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Kai

customer_reviews.title: Quality product - would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Quality product that works well inside the front door to prevent water, dirt and leaves from being tracked into the house. (NB I have not used it outside.) It arrived tightly rolled and has taken a while to flatten out completely. I had to put some heavy weights on the corners initially to stop the door catching on the edge of the mat. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Zoe Egan McInally

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars!
customer_reviews.text: Love this cute mat! It is perfect for my bathroom. The floor in bathroom is always wet, so the water proof frame really works! The mat is always dry and clean. Even it gets dirt, the wool material seems really easy to wash and clean
customer_reviews.author: Michael Jaqueline

customer_reviews.title: of good quality, and it stays in place very happy ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in a flat box. there is not an issue of being curled. It looks very durable, of good quality, and it stays in place very happy with this!
customer_reviews.author: Ling

customer_reviews.title: Nope.
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually do reviews, but this was a major disappointment. The rug came damaged (the rubber edge was ripped away from the rest of the rug), the smell was almost unbearable (and I can handle smells, I teach toddlers for a living), and even the box it came in was tattered with previous barcode stickers removed like it had been around the block a few times already. No wonder! Not impressed. Just sayin.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Morman

customer_reviews.title: Smells awful.
customer_reviews.text: Other reviewers weren't kidding when they said this thing stinks. I thought maybe they were being over sensitive, but It smells like a tire shop, but much stronger. I bought it to protect the cargo area of my SUV and let it air out outside for a few days before using it and it made my car smell awful just having it in there a few hours. It is possible the smell will go away in time, but I wouldn't recommend this for indoor use as it will make your whole house stink. Other than the smell, it is a great mat.
customer_reviews.author: R. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: quality
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good looking outdoor mat, that looks good and does the job. After searching out several mats I decided on the brown Amagabeli rubber mat. I like the look and quality already recieved compliments on this mat. The size fits my front door perfectly and now I want one for my Back door.
customer_reviews.author: Jozie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Large Outdoor Door Mat!
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived today and we love the high quality of this product so now we will be ordering another one today! They also will give you 10%off on next order if you are satisfied with your first order. We would not be buying this product if it wasn't above standard and we both are completely pleased with the product! We will be glad to tell you if this review has changed because of unsatisfactory product! For right now we are very pleased and we will order this product again!
customer_reviews.author: L&J

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is a good quality and good value doormat. I used it in my master bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: DON'T INHALE!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't pay attention to the reviews that complained about the smell. The majority of reviewers didn't mention it. We can't even use this mat in the garage because it makes the dogs sick. It has been outside on the driveway for three days and it stinks up the neighborhood. The mat looks good and is sturdy, but the SMELL is outrageous.
customer_reviews.author: Allatkertesz

customer_reviews.title: Nice mat. Company gives perks for 5 star reviews
customer_reviews.text: We like the door mat, it's great. It's a door mat. What originally helped me make my decision to buy this was the overwhelming amount of great reviews it had received. When I received my item, however, it had a tag saying "5 Starts Rating = 10% OFF", with the amazon symbol on it. For me this felt like a bummer. I would not trust this company's five-star ratings, and I probably won't buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: NorNorNor

customer_reviews.title: Thin and incredibly stinky
customer_reviews.text: The mat is relatively thin and thus can't help much with cleaning the soles of your shoes, but the main problem is that the mat generates the most intense petrochemical odor of all time. It's been in my backyard for weeks, in wet and dry weather, yet the stench shows no sign of abating. You can smell it from several feet away. Touch the mat, and your hand stinks. I threw the mat away.
customer_reviews.author: Small firm lawyer

customer_reviews.title: THE 24” x 36” SIZE IS PERFECT..
customer_reviews.text: The mat is BEAUTIFUL! A truly WONDERFUL mat. Previously, I’d gotten only smaller 18” x 30” of decorator types, but they’d quickly fade. For winter, needing something now, I found this pattern and the tanish color very attractive. Chose to get the larger, 24” x 36” size with a bit of trepidation I learned I needn’t have. Actually, the size is perfect. It fits the width of the door. I’ll never go back to the previous size. Looks very, very good. I’m very happy. PS No smell, as others had written, but the one edge did curl, when unfurling it. Laid heavy things on it, and I have no doubt it’ll flatten perfectly in time.
customer_reviews.author: ilovedaisies

customer_reviews.title: Nice mats!
customer_reviews.text: They look very nice on the porch and quality is very good! Very pleased with them.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Brown

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I have a doormat already on the front porch, but there is bare cement where my cats eat, so I got this for that area and I am pleased and so are my cats. They give it 4 paws up! , and I give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Al K Seltzer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: This rug is annoying, to say the least. It gets incredibly soaking wet every single time that it rains and needs to be hung over the back of my deck, so is not actually by my door half the time. It is no way, shape or form an outdoor rug. It also does little to nothing to help scrape off or clean my dirty shoes when I come inside. Huge waste of money and I am complete disappointed in my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Angela V.

customer_reviews.title: This door mat smells absolutely foul - petrochemical stench
customer_reviews.text: This door mat smells absolutely foul - petrochemical stench. I wanted to put it inside my garage before you enter the house and we had to put it outside at the back door to get the smell out of the garage. Not worth returning. I had much better luck with door mats I could put inside the house from LL Bean.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Craven

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing Rug!!!!!!!!! Don’t listen to the negative reviews. I swear some people just like to complain.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen P.

customer_reviews.title: Good doormat
customer_reviews.text: The doormats meet my needs. They look good and do the job as long as I wipe my feet before entering the house. Bought 2, one placed by patio sliding door, and the other by garage door entrance to house. As long as I wipe my shoes on the mats before entering the house they should do the job. As an aside I went to the garage barefooted and was surprised to learn the mat felt good on my bare feet,. A little extra plus.good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: phil clifton

customer_reviews.title: When it rains, it’s Poor...
customer_reviews.text: What kind of outdoor mat can be sold that when it rains the mat holds water for days? My shoes are soaked when I enter the house days after a rain. And now I can predict that in the winter the ice will form and can lead to a catastrophe. This mat sits right outside my door and is under a small roof awning. My last mat outside this door lasted at least 6-8 years. Take this “outdoor mat” off the market.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean and vacuum.
customer_reviews.text: I use this mat inside front door. It is great for wiping wet feet before stepping into carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Marty Burke

customer_reviews.title: Great for cleaning car floor mats that you don't want to clean on a dirty driveway
customer_reviews.text: I detail cars for a living. I mainly use this for when I'm cleaning floor mats. I do not want to clean the floor mat on a dirty driveway or garage floor. I lay this mat down which is huge by the way then place the floor mat on top of this then I start cleaning it. It makes the floor mat cling to this large outdoor mat so the car floor mat stays in place. Works very well for me in this instance. I am sure it will.do the same just using it as a doormat outside your front door of your house.
customer_reviews.author: DON KARLO

customer_reviews.title: This thing smells like gasoline will throw it in the trash we're it ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing smells like gasoline will throw it in the trash we're it belongs waste of time and money tried washing it with Dawn and hot water and let air dry unfortunately it is made of what I believe is recycled tires which are know in the state of California to cause cancer I believe it after smelling this awful thing not worth my time to send back or contact seller because you would not buy something that smelled this bad in a real store so why mail it to someone and expect them to be ok with that smelled lol what a joke!!!
customer_reviews.author: ty

customer_reviews.title: Great Mat
customer_reviews.text: I had heard that the mat comes with a smell. I have found that most things packaged do. I read the reviews and tried one right off the bat, instead of complaining I opened the package and set it out side for a little over 24 hours on my porch. I brought it in and it was fine (I did not stick my nose on the mat I just know it didn't have a smell in the room. ) I use it in my kitchen and have absolutely no complaints. It is a very nice matt and I am glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Tracie

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Very unhappy. Extremely strong smell. Placed inside front door, first time opened the door, edge ripped off.
customer_reviews.author: michele sandell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for an apartment with a long narrow foyer
customer_reviews.text: I got this 36” x 59” door mat after moving into a new apartment with a long narrow foyer. The regular sized door mats were too short, and I found my guest stepping all over my hardwood floor before taking off their shoes. This door mat solves that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Ben L.

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate Dimensions and won't lie flat
customer_reviews.text: This seemed a bit small for the advertised 30x18 when it arrived so I measured it. It is closer to 29 x 17.75. Although that isn't much, this is the most blatantly misleading description I have ever seen on Amazon. I ordered this because it is very, very low profile but I wanted to cover as much space at my entry as possible. It arrived rolled up 24 hrs ago and I am still trying to get it to lie flat--I held it flat to measure it. It looks like I have to try carpet tape.
customer_reviews.author: badgers22

customer_reviews.title: I ordered two and one was fine, the second arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: The mats in and of themselves are okay. I ordered two and one was fine, the second arrived damaged. The rubber was completely not attached on one of the shorter sides of the mat. I was able to fix it with some super glue, but I was disappointed. The packaging was also not ideal. Not only are they taped up like they're trying to escape, they're rolled so tightly that I still haven't been successful in flattening them out completely. If you're willing to, it might be wise to weigh them down for a few days with heavy books or pots. Unfortunately, I needed them immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Mister Chitters

customer_reviews.title: Smells like burnt tires
customer_reviews.text: Smells like burnt tires....waste of money...I had to throw it away after several attempts to get the smell out.
customer_reviews.author: Windy

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: Very nearly perefctly fits the size of our front doorway. Love it : )
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice and does it's job well
customer_reviews.text: Effective at collecting dirt and looks so good I put it inside. Removes lite dirt well, which is what 90% of the dirt is, but treads are not deep enough for the exceptional mud. That's why I have a less elegante more industrial mat on the outside too, catch big stuff outside then this one gets what may have been missed. Has a lite resin odor when you first put it out that quickly dissipates.
customer_reviews.author: Derby City David

customer_reviews.title: Too thin. Not for outdoor use.
customer_reviews.text: This mat is super thin. It's NOT for outdoor use at all. When it rains, you're left with a squishy puddle because it doesn't absorb or redirect anything. I also thought the notches would be thicker, but they're not. So wiping you shoes does absolutely nothing. Also, beware: the seller is bribing people to leave 5-star reviews, saying they get a discount in the future. Not ethical. And it is inflating the reviews on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Weise

customer_reviews.title: stinks like a chemical factory
customer_reviews.text: I purchased three of these doormats. They all stink like a chemical factory. They have been outside in the sun for two weeks, and they still stink to high heaven. I'm not sure how long it will take to de-stink them, but they cannot be brought indoors until they are odor-free. update: These rugs have been outside in the sun for 6 months, and they still smell like a chemical factory. Yuck.
customer_reviews.author: JR Dobbs

customer_reviews.title: Smells -  Stinks actually.
customer_reviews.text: I've heard stories before about not being able to get the smell out of something, but this was my first. We scrubbed it with soap and a plastic brush twice and put it outside to dry both times. Then, the washing machine-- full cycle SIX times. It still smells awful. In the patio, it smells up the whole room. It is now an outdoor rug. Wondering if in 6 months it can be brought in LOL.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky Mountain Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Nice, economical, low profile rug...
customer_reviews.text: For my needs, this rug is perfect. I'm actually using it just inside my front door. I require a very low profile rug there, or else the door catches on it when opened/closed, and this fits the bill perfectly. We have tile in that area, and the rug does slide a bit on the tile, so I will need to address that. The leaf pattern is very pretty. I wish the rug came in other colors, as I'd have preferred a more colorful option, but I knew the color when I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: AWFUL SMELL and POOR QUALITY!
customer_reviews.text: Awful chemical smell. Just the short time I had it out of the box and laying on the floor, my entire living room smelled like it was full of fumes. Not sure how anyone can keep this inside their home. I had to throw the box away quickly before it reaked the house and garage. After 2 weeks outside (on coverered stoop) the edges are all curled up and the mat is wavy. Thowing away since it is a hazard to anyone who may trip on it. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: LikeAFineWine

customer_reviews.title: Large Outdoor/Indoor Door Mats
customer_reviews.text: I just received my two mats that are the same color & size, and love the look and color. I put the front door mat outside and the backdoor mat on the inside. At first I was disappointed that the mats weren't thicker, but I realized that they are just fine and the mats would have cost more if they were thicker. The thickness is perfect for my almost 92 year old father-in-law who lives with us. Dad does not trip on these mats. I definitely recommend these lovely and functional mats.
customer_reviews.author: Coco47

customer_reviews.title: Thin - Flimsy - Curled
customer_reviews.text: This rug is thinner and flimsier than I hoped. Especially for the price. I've had it laid flat for over 2 weeks in a warm house, and it's still curled from the packaging. - Update: Months later, having put weights on all of the edges, I still cannot get this thing to flatten out. I have other mats that are great quality, this one is far from that. A mat like this should cost $5.
customer_reviews.author: ShuaMN

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size!
customer_reviews.text: This mat is perfect for the landing just inside our side door. We have a tile landing that is approximately 3' x 3' and most mats won't fit. This is the perfect length so it's not sliding around on the tile floor. Now I don't have to worry about the dog sliding as he jumps inside the house or anyone's shoes sliding as we come in. It's got a nice stiff texture so it helps remove some of the mud/dirt from paws and shoes. Just what I was looking for. The only thing is that it does have a strong rubber/plastic smell for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Ladyflower

customer_reviews.title: Soaks up water;  retains it.  Ends up misshapen
customer_reviews.text: Used at doorway entrance on front porch and rear patio. Both locations under cover. In spite of this, the mats retain tremendous quantities of water and were rendered useless as a floor mat to remove dirt and debris. Additionally, fluid retention caused the mats to deform. This caused a 'tripping' danger, exactly what a mat was supposed to help avoid. I'm 67 and this is a hazard to my health . I already have one hip replacement and not anxious for the other. Perhaps it is (they are) useful just inside the door, but absolutely useless and dangerous positioned outside.
customer_reviews.author: DFW

customer_reviews.title: Great, just give it a little time to relax
customer_reviews.text: This works great, for my front entry. The only problem I've had, is that it wouldn't "uncurl" when it came out of the packing. I had company coming within the next 36 hrs, and I was finding anything heavy in the house I could find to hold down the corners and stretch them out, flat. A very interesting experience. 36 hrs later, friends came for a party (and it was pouring rain outside) so a good entry door mat was essential. It really does look good, (when it finally decided to lay flat on the floor. Just a thought): Purchase this, and plan ahead, to adapt in the first 12 hrs or so.
customer_reviews.author: Loving Life

customer_reviews.title: Quality control needed
customer_reviews.text: See my review. The mat has a black spot that looks like grease but is part of the product. Update: The company promptly sent a replacement which was as advertised. Good customer service. Nice mat.
customer_reviews.author: JC Pounds

customer_reviews.title: These rugs/welcome mats are horrible - DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: After doing a rather thorough search we decided to purchase 3 of these rugs for our new home. It is about 10 days post receipt and they look horrible, undue to our influence. Yes, it has rained here but not on the rugs. They are thin, look dirty and don't stay in place. Having wanted a welcoming message via the mats, the message received by visitors would have been received as: "stay away from this place - they are dirty".
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Pretty, but poor quality and strong tire smell.
customer_reviews.text: The quality was poor. The design was appealing and the water proof ness of the rubber used on the mat held up to the claims. However, this May has such a string odor like that of rubber tires, and that odor has not subsided. I scrubbed the mat with a brush and soap and left it out in the sun for two whole weeks and it still smells. The box it came in even smells. Don’t do it. I am returning it so cannot speak to durability but, even though the rubber appears to be water proof, it also appears almost brittle, as if it would crack and break after minimal treading upon it. I was very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: H Family

customer_reviews.title: It's the perfect size and color.
customer_reviews.text: It's the perfect size and color for the back stairs landing in my home. It absorbs water but you have to wipe your feet to keep from tracking anything else into the house. You can't put in washing machine so I haven't cleaned mine yet. I'll try my laundry sink since I don't want to wash it outdoors with a hose. Again I do like it. It doesn't move a lot so that's good. It's great looking when it's clean. Be aware: the color I bought was tan like the picture even though it says brown when you order it. I like tan so I got what the picture looked like. I'm glad I bought it. Price was good.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: This rubber mat is attractive and functional. Non-slip and protecting from water damage. there was a rubber odor when I got this product. it would take one day to air out, the surface of mat have more fibers to wipe your shoes off on, since we are both on a limited income, I tried to find something not too expensive, Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Ava Taylor

customer_reviews.title: great mat - love it
customer_reviews.text: Its brand new so its not had much use other than taking off the tags and putting in place. Looks great and I have received instructions on how to clean it, etc. Looking forward to using it. Now after a week of rain showers, mud getting tracked to the deck door, and the in and out, I can honestly say this rug is really great. Looks great, and is easy to clean off. Keeps mud and leaves from coming in to the closed part of my deck. Glad I purchased this door mat and will likely purchase another for another location in my home.
customer_reviews.author: C. D. Black-Nixon

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart; black smudges everywhere
customer_reviews.text: Before long, the black rubbery bottom starting falling apart. Little pieces of black rubber were all around it. There was never any water on it or underneath it, but when I picked it up, I could see a lot of black smudge marks. That rubbery stuff on the bottom is not colorfast. It slipped around too. The traction isn't very good. It's in the trash now. Buying a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Blind Faith 99

customer_reviews.title: Overpowering smell of rubber even after over a month- unusable.
customer_reviews.text: The overpowering smell of rubber almost knocked me out when I opened the box. It lingered in the apartment even after I brought it outside. We unrolled it and let it sit on the patio for nearly a month now, hoping the smell would go away. It has NOT. Every time we open the door to our back patio, we are hit with toxic chemical fumes. Waited too long to see if the product would improve and is now past the return date, will be throwing away. Do NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.author: rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Solid, just like the picture
customer_reviews.text: Looks exactly like the picture. Solid, slightly bigger than I expected (which is not a bad thing). It was shipped flat, not rolled, which meant I didn't have to struggle with flattening out corners or worrying that someone might trip on it. When you first take it out there is a chemical smell, but I'd probably stink too if I'd been sealed in a box for days. The smell goes away quickly (especially since I'm using this outside my front door). In a couple days there was no discernible odor. I'd certainly buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Lila B

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a little over 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Had it on the outside porch for a little over 2 years now. It has started to crack on the back side all over, falling apart. Not a high traffic area but is exposed to the rain and sun. I expected much more from this mat. I have 2 mats I got from Bed Bath & Beyond 9 years ago. They are wearing out now but have lasted over 4x longer than this one in the same conditions on the rear porch. They were about the same price. Will not be buying this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: water
customer_reviews.text: i think when i purchased this it was over $50. it is on our front porch stoop which is not covered at all but since this is an indoor outdoor mat i thought it would be fine. Nope, it's holding water like crazy. when you step on it after a rain, water squirts and puddles i hateeee it.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Makes everyone , including the pup to wipe there paws when entering.
customer_reviews.text: Mat looked great at first although the thickness was not what was mentioned. Placed it in front of the sliding glass door. But now, just three weeks later, it is showing signs of significant wear on all of the colors on the raised sections. Since this is the secondary entrance to the home it does not get a lot of traffic. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: JulieD

customer_reviews.title: Great rug
customer_reviews.text: Great outdoor rug. Thick and stays put. Seems to catch alot if dirt and mud... would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: D. A

customer_reviews.title: I really like my new rug
customer_reviews.text: I really like my new rug. It matches my door really well. The only thing that I wish was a little heavier backing. I bought the rug because the rug I did have would fold up and blow against my front door on windy days. I was always having to fix it and it was really bugging me. So far I haven't had to fool with this one and it has stayed in place. I am happy with my purchase and thank you for the quick delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Moisture Barrier
customer_reviews.text: We use these under our dog's large water dish. He drools a trail of water almost every time he takes a drink and if the water sits too long on our floor it warps. This mat is large enough to protect the main area that is affected from his drinking habits. In the summer we put the water dish outside and use the mat by the dog door, which works great. We bought a bigger one to use by the front door during the winter months we loved it so much! We have had the first one for almost 2 years and it's still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Eastridge

customer_reviews.title: Still in one piece!
customer_reviews.text: I really do like this floor mat. However, I use it inside where it slips on my laminate floor. I've had to place a mat pad beneath it that keeps rugs from sliding which helps greatly. My three crazy dogs haven't yet torn this apart, after 3 months the mat is still in very similar shape to what it when it came out of the box. It has helped to reduce the amount of mud the dogs track into the house. Though I doubt anything will ever stop it completely. The texture is comfortable enough for bare feet yet stiff enough to stand up to scraping muddy shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Penny Girl

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: When this door mat arrived we really liked it. However, there is one serious problem, it holds water. When it rains a lot of water gets on the mat and stays there. The rubber backing does not allow any water to go through. We constantly have to take the mat up and put it on it's side to let the water run off and the mat dry. I do not recommend this mat for any place that it could get wet.
customer_reviews.author: JWB

customer_reviews.title: Good inside entry mat.
customer_reviews.text: I can only guess at the overall rating, cleanability, absorbency and durability of this mat, as we've only had it for a few months. We are using ours as an entry mat, and I'm not sure I would recommend it as an outside mat; we already have a good old recycled-tire mat outside. There was a strong petroleum odor for a few days, but that dissipated and the mat has become a favorite napping place for our cats. My only wish is that the mat were just a few inches larger. Otherwise, doing fine. The door clearance is excellent, the look is pleasant, and I plan to clean it occasionally by throwing it in the bathtub or hosing it down.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Talbert

customer_reviews.title: STRONG SMELL LINGERS FOR MONTHS
customer_reviews.text: I'm not really sure how to rate this product. It works fine as a doormat, but for the first year or so I had it the smell of whatever the plastic backing on it is was so strong I couldn't stand to get near it. Instead of putting it right by my door, I put it all the way across the porch, and even then the unpleasant odor sometimes wafted over. If you have a year to let the mat "air out" or "off gas," go ahead and get it. If you are affected by strong smells, stay away.
customer_reviews.author: R. Tapp

customer_reviews.title: NOT non-slip!
customer_reviews.text: Description says non-slip—one of the reasons I bought it. I put it inside back door on linoleum—and it slides all over the place. Dangerous!! And I agree with other reviews—smelly and thin. Cheap—but you get what you pay for. I’ll stick with Weather Guard door mats. They’re substantial and truly have a non-slip backing.
customer_reviews.author: Avid reader in AZ

customer_reviews.title: nice but on the thin side
customer_reviews.text: the mat has only been on the front porch under the overhang for a week but has gone thru 2 big rainstorms with a lot of wind.so far it is taking the beating. i was hoping it would be a little more plush with the nap, but at the price it was selling for, it is ok. right now it is basking in the morning sun and should be dry by this afternoon.
customer_reviews.author: STANLEY STARR

customer_reviews.title: Simply Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Have inside front door for now, plan to move outside. For now though, it is great. Stays put on the floor. Good for wiping feet. Spilled a drink on it and the liquid just stayed in mat. Didn't seep through. Nice. Of course it wasn't there long, but still. Haven't really put it to any serious tests, but I think it could handle some stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive but you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I was quite disappointed with the quality of this mat as I would not describe it as having a rubber backing or a non-skid backing. Maybe it qualifies as a rubber backing, but to the touch it feels like hard plastic, not pliable rubber. As a result, it skids quite easily on any hard surface. It would be fine on carpeting, but we need a mat on a tiled area, so this one did not work.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Walter

customer_reviews.title: Its pungent smell does not go away
customer_reviews.text: This mat's surface traps dirt better than other types. It also traps water so effectively that at the slightest drop of rain I have to hang it out to dry, rendering it useless for as long as it is still dripping from a handrail. When it first arrived it reeked of a pungent chemical smell. I thought it would eventually dissipate. It does not My porch smells like a chemical factory. After it is soaked wet, when it dries up the smell is just as bad as when it was new. I would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph F. Delgado

customer_reviews.title: but the design is nice and it seems decently absorbent
customer_reviews.text: This is fairly thin, but the design is nice and it seems decently absorbent. If you are looking for something super heavy duty, you'll probably want something else - but for the front door of my apartment (that is in an open stairwell so it stay covered and relatively dry) it's fine. There isn't enough material to scrap mud out of shoes, but if you are just looking for something to wipe your feet on this will work great. And the design is nice. It arrived rolled up and took a few days to flatten out, but it's fine now.
customer_reviews.author: Joy3888

customer_reviews.title: Everything's fine so far
customer_reviews.text: Mine arrived in excellent shape. All the seams are tight and straight; no loose fibers or threads, laid flat within a day of setting it out, color matches what the ad showed. The surface rolls have a great criss-cross pattern which performs great for wiping. It looks like it will last a long time doing hard outdoor duty, although mine's on a side entry and won't see too much action. I'd definitely buy another if/when needed for another location.
customer_reviews.author: StarvinMarvin

customer_reviews.title: God as it gets
customer_reviews.text: No can’t answer much on easy to clean (I’ve shakes it out a few times. But after it lost its memory to the poster like roll, it’s been flat. It’s doesn’t seem long enough in fibers to brush a muddyshoe with, but I think those shoes that haven’t been covered wit mud works fine. Attractive led pattern.
customer_reviews.author: Wili1

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and curled up
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a cheap Chinese imitation of the Gorilla Grip mats, which are better but very overpriced. Comes rolled up in a tube shape, and the edges of mine are still curled up three weeks later after laying it out. The backing is not anti-skid, at least in cold weather. It slips & slides easily on smooth surfaces. And for this item, you will always need to "avoid violent stampede" according to the box. Which is inconvenient for me :)
customer_reviews.author: onlineshoppinggeek

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice but smells terrible!
customer_reviews.text: Fits in space and lays flat nicely after laying some heavy books on it for a few days. I like the pattern. Only issue is the smell! This should definitely be left outside, if able, for at least a few days. We put it in our basement for a week when we got it (weather wouldn't allow it to be placed outside) and I had to hold my breath when I walked down there because it was so bad. We now have it in our entry way and I can still faintly smell the rubber when I come in to the house (it's been about a month since we got it).
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: i am updating my review because of the amazing response by this company's quick customer service regarding my review of this mat. They have been great and are replacing free of charge, I highly suggest just hosing off this mat and not washing in the machine. We live on a ranch and the mat gets heavy traffic! It's very durable and looks nice I should not have washed it but it did say washable 😀
customer_reviews.author: Grannie Judy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the product, but very appreciative of seller's response
customer_reviews.text: Within less than a month, this mat is showing signs of deterioration even with minimal use and fair weather (no rain, temperatures in the 70s and 80s, and no direct sunlight). The lettering is starting to crumble and its looking unsightly. At this rate, I'll have to dump it. I cannot recommend this product. Since, the above was written, the seller has taken steps to help remedy the situation, which I appreciate. For this reason, I have increased the star rating to reflect my current satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel S. L.

customer_reviews.title: More light duty than heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: I have had two of these mats for about 6 weeks. They came rolled up and I had to roll them the opposite of the way they came because they wouldn't lay flat. They still have a few places where the edge rubber doesn't lay flat on the floor. If I had to order rugs again, I'd order a heavy duty rug.
customer_reviews.author: Rev Beau

customer_reviews.title: Good quality ... But the outgassing will drive you out of your home.
customer_reviews.text: We bought these mats for use inside to wipe and place shoes on. We got two of them. They outgassed so badly we moved them to the back porch to air out. After three days we brought them inside but they still smelled so bad we are now using them outside on our porch as a double welcome mat. They are good quality, but you cannot even open the box inside or you will be gassed. They are not for indoor use without a gas mask.
customer_reviews.author: Tashishen

customer_reviews.title: Very strong smell doesn't go away
customer_reviews.text: I have to agree with the other reviewers that the smell of the rubber on this is much too strong to be used indoors. Even after airing it outside for a few days, the smell fills the room. This makes it unusable for me. It's also quite thin and a bit stiff, which is acceptable to me at this price, but if you are looking for something more supple and that doesn't form a persistent crease in itself when draped over a chair (which I did to air it out on our deck), then you should look elsewhere. Regardless of the thinness, the smell was a deal-breaker for me all by itself.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great durable door mat
customer_reviews.text: This has become my absolute favorite type of doormat for inside. Super easy to clean with a shampooer hose tool or just take outside and hose off. Very durable because the entire bottom is leak resistant rubber. Especially with having pets in my house, this is the only type of mat that works well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah BoughterTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: Durability is there, I can't seem to vacuum hay out of it, so hard to clean. Light weight, so light weight the corners curl and I can't get them down. Wish it was heavier. This is inside, in front of my entry door, it doesn't have a strong smell at all and it works.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Fernelius

customer_reviews.title: Good Entrance Mat for My Patio
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and Attractive. I was Looking for a replacement mat for outside of my patio door. I ordered this one and I am very pleased. It is very attractive and the raised pattern allows you to scrape off any debris before entering the house. I’ve only had it a few weeks but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Della

customer_reviews.title: Don't purchase
customer_reviews.text: These are terrible. I bought 1 for my indoor condo hallway and one for my condo outside patio door. The indoor one is still off-gassing. The outdoor one is sopping wet for days after a rain or snow. I bought the 6 months ago.
customer_reviews.author: J. C.

customer_reviews.title: Attractive, but not super functional.
customer_reviews.text: Very "cute" door mat that I got for my wife. She likes it a lot and it still looks good after 6 months that includes a midwest winter. Realizing that it is a decorative door mat, I must give my criticism though. Very firm and won't wipe off much dirt or mud. Also, it takes a while to dry out. So if you run out in your socks to get the mail, it still might be wet. We like it none the less. Feel free to ask any questions. If you found this review helpful please mark it to let me know.
customer_reviews.author: POWERPRO

customer_reviews.title: It could be better if did not hold water.
customer_reviews.text: This mat is perfect until it gets wet. When it rains, water doesn't drain from it and could stay wet for several days. So when we step on it, even two days after raining, our shoes get all wet. I have to either bring the mat inside when it rains or hang it to dry, which defies the purpose of it. I have a similar looking mat which has little wholes underneath that allows water to escape and dries right after it stops raining.
customer_reviews.author: J. Salce

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love it! 😍😍
customer_reviews.text: I've been searching everywhere for a paw print door mat and I came across this one. After reading a couple reviews about it, I decided to go ahead and purchase one myself. It's exactly as pictured and described in the ad. The quality is definitely top notch. It doesn't slide around while I use it and it works perfectly. I'm so in love with the bright bold colors. I'm extremely happy with my purchase and will most definitely be purchasing another for the back door.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work. If it gets wet, you know, because it's outside? It NEVER dries off. It will not scrape anything off of your shoes. I'm trashing this to get one of those Astroturf ones AVOID. JUNK
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not last long.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this mat indoors for 1 1/2 years and it is completely dry rotted and shredding. It is placed in front of a bedroom sliding door onto a balcony. Very little traffic. It is also very thin, not the type of mat designed for heavy traffic, as in an entrance door.
customer_reviews.author: BigXor

customer_reviews.title: SATURATED!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to put outside my sliding door, hoping the dogs can get some dirt off of their paws before coming inside. It briefly rained the night that I got it, and was still beyond saturated the next afternoon. I'd read some similar reviews about it, but just didn't expect it to be that bad. So I guess it's ok when the weather is nice?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight Doormat
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 18x30 brown doormat. It arrived in very good condition and was packaged very well. The measurements are not accurate as the actual size is 17x29 as seen in the photo along with the old one I was replacing. The old one is an actual 18x30 mat. The new mat is lighter weight and not nearly as heavy duty as my old one; however, it seems to be good quality. Time will tell if it holds up as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Choice
customer_reviews.text: I have invested in heavy, expensive door mats for our screened-in porch because we live in the woods and debris is easily carried inside. They were heavy and difficult to clean; so I researched alternatives. Happily I landed on the Amagabeli mats! They do the job; they are light-weight enough to pick up and clean; they are extremely attractive. Wish I had seen them earlier!
customer_reviews.author: BetsyB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Mat
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly in front of the door and coordinates well with our beige/brown exterior.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I thought these would be a bit more substantial. The edges are thin and, even though they have been weighted downs for a couple of weeks, the edges are still curling. They give us something for cleaning off shoes and boots, thus the three stars. I wish I had shopped more.
customer_reviews.author: M. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: It looks exactly like the picture
customer_reviews.text: I just received this rug and immediately put it outside in front of my door. It looks exactly like the picture. This items feels like it is made with quality material and I definitely foresee it holding up to the outdoor elements. This item came rolled up so it did take about 24 hours for it to lay completely flat. I am overall very pleased, great quality for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Youngman

customer_reviews.title: Very nice mat. Color
customer_reviews.text: Very nice mat. Color, graphics, mat size and weight are super and at a great price. I have looked at these which are a thicker mat, but at triple the price of this mat. While I cannot attest to its durability at this point since I've only had it in place for about one month, it does seem thick enough and should work fine. I would recommend and am considering purchasing others for as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Ang

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great size, design, color and feel. Very soft to walk on but durable enough to shuffle feet and not tear or pill. The bottom has a nice rubber grip so it does not slide out of place. The leaf pattern is subtle, which is what I wanted. It adds great depth to the rug without being too busy or distracting. The color is a nice medium brown - perfect to hide dirt but light enough to also hide the little white hair from my yellow lab dog. There was a minor rubber smell when I first opened the box which is due to the new-ness of the product. It lasted only a couple of hours. I will buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Very great quality, and even better looking
customer_reviews.text: This was the second mat I purchased, the first one I ended up returning because the look wasn't so great and the quality wasn't so great either. However this one is not only great looking but the quality is even better! Worked perfectly, no issues. Great product, would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nima Saba

customer_reviews.title: good mat, just won't lay flat
customer_reviews.text: kept it in the hot sun for a couple of days, both upside down and right side up, but it just won't release the folded memory. so I have a rug that works great but is a slight trip hazard.
customer_reviews.author: george

customer_reviews.title: Useful Decorative outdoor mat
customer_reviews.text: We have used this special doormat on our porch now for about a month and it seemed to work very fine even during several weather changes. Through rain, sleet and snow we used it to wipe our feet. It seemed to work perfectly just as described. We were very pleased with the result. We got the leafy pattern gives us a decorative alternative to something plain. We like this mat. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Samula

customer_reviews.title: Appearance is as photographed, but thickness and weight a little on the light side
customer_reviews.text: Bought for entryway. Wanted something that would STAY IN PLACE, and it mostly does that. However, it is not heavy enough for what I wanted... I wish I had cut a newspaper and put it on the floor to see the size... would have liked a bigger one. But, there it is and I assume it will last at least a couple years... if it doesn't I'll be changing my review.
customer_reviews.author: YsLadyMN

product_meta.title: Amagabeli Large Outdoor Door Mats Rubber Shoes Scraper 36" x 24" for Front Door Entrance Outside Doormat Patio Rug Dirt Debris Mud Waterproof Out Door Mat Low Profile Washable Carpet Brown
product_meta.description: Size:36" x 24"| Color:Light BrownThe doormat is 24"×36", 2/5 inch thick, a great size for the front or back door.
feature_bullets: SUPER HEAVY DUTY DURABLE MATS: This heavy duty doormat rug size is 36in X 24in, 2/5 inch thick, while most other door mats are lightweight and 1/4 thick. Our doormat rug is made of polypropylene fabric so that the door mat is perfect for capture mud and dust, so this doormat can be called as a mud scraper to use. Our doormat rug has a special pattern which absorb moisture and dirt easily.

FAST DRYING MATERIAL: The durable doormat dry quickly after rain or snow. Our door mat is designed to be durable and strong, heavy duty large and long door mats entrance durable rug carpet widely used for all weather outdoor front door, exterior patio entry way, porch door, garage, garden, winter, commercial deal with high traffic inside and outside.

NON-SLIP & 100% NATURAL RUBBER BACKING: The outdoor doormat comes with already build in non-skid rug runner pad mat with natural rubber back for maximum grip to avoid you to skid while you walk and protect your floor to help prevent everyday wear and tear. While most door mats are made of various recycled materials, our doormat is made of 100% natural rubber.

EASY TO CLEAN & SCRAP DIRT: Simply vacuum with a hand-held vacuum, sweep with a broom or use a garden hose to rinse the mat outdoor, our outside doormat is designed with the rubber border that helps to form a retention dam to trap moisture, mud, dirt, dust, grit and absorb moisture from shoes.

CUSTOMER CARE: We are dedicated to provide premium products for you and offer impeccable customer care to you. If you have any issue, please contact us through Amazon return window and we will give you a satisfied solution within 24 hours and without any loss.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars2,144 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
